Topic.Title: Want proof Wall Street is rigged. Here's proof. T

Message.Msg: Actually I didn't lose anything. I still own the stock. It is a paper loss. I have owned T for about 14 years and wouldn't think of selling it. If you want a quick buck go to a casino. Now is the time to be accumulating this stock not selling it. T is a solid company and a good long term investment

Message.Title: More racist nonsense...
Message.Msg: ... Romney advisor preaching to their base by stirring the racial cauldron. “In remarks that may prompt accusations of racial insensitivity, one suggested that Mr. Romney was better placed to understand the depth of ties between the two countries than Mr. Obama, whose father was from Africa ‘We are part of an Anglo-Saxon heritage, and he feels that the special relationship is special,’ the adviser said of Mr. Romney, adding: ‘The White House didn’t fully appreciate the shared history we have’.” – The Telegraph, 7/24/12 http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/mitt-romney/9424524/Mitt-Romney-would-restore-Anglo-Saxon-relations-between-Britain-and-America.html The “special relationship is special”?????? What, that he’s white? Oh, isn’t that special!!!! Wonder why he didn’t bring that up at the NAACP meeting recently.
What happened to you man? Why are you being so blatantly political! What happened to your sense of humor?

... "Why are you being so blatantly political!" Oh, good point. Certainly no one else on this board is political, right? Why don't you criticize them and the continuous barrage of aberrant rants? "What happened to your sense of humor?" You know, ck, actually I find that post extremely humorous. A presumptive party's nominee for the Presidency is suggesting that the duly elected President somehow can't relate to the United Kingdom and its people because he's not Anglo-Saxon. Not only is THAT funny, but that those supporting him accept it, is hilarious. I would have thought you'd be more upset with a GOP advisor saying it, rather than me bringing it up.

I just thought that you were above the rest of the board that you find political. I must say that I can't wait until Nov 6. One, it is my birthday. Two, maybe all the political BS will be over for awhile! I doubt it, but I am an optimist.
WHY NOT 21?

Topic.Title: The Land Owners' and Businessmens' Enemy

Message.Msg: Washington DC is a microcosm of what the whole nation would be under Communism. Look and learn.
If the master AAPL is down $30 and more to come, the slave T can go to $19, me think.
AT&T without AAPL is worthless company single digit like Spring. Now AAPL going down T should go faster down not up. What wast of money!!!
Oh, don't fear, you WON'T hear from me again for some time, AND the price WILL continue to go up!
Thanks. I guess it wasn't me after all. Stocks do tend to make one paranoid.

<Wonder why he didn’t bring that up at the NAACP meeting recently.> Oh he did, big time. Even his eyes showed it, it was funny to watch. Advisors need to be monitored, don't they. Obama saw little of his father, which is a sad story. Ironically his core values came from his patriotic "anglo" grandparents in Hawaii. They definitely didn't move to Mexico to circumvent US law, like Romney's "anglo" clan did. They didn't teach Barack to try and get out of serving his country by clever claims to avoid the draft, either.

Message.Title: This should help T
Message.Msg: "AT&T will deliver high bandwidth connectivity to NLR's national network infrastructure for leading health sciences institutions, starting with Saint John's Health Center in Santa Monica, California. "Saint John's is delighted to be the first hospital in the country to connect," said Lou Lazatin, President and CEO of Saint John's Health Center. "This will allow Saint John's and its cancer research subsidiary, the renowned John Wayne Cancer Institute, to create a gene sequencing center enabling identification of genetic, genomic, and clinical information to tailor treatment and targeted therapies to each individual's disease."

The chart: http://finance.yahoo.com/echarts?s=T#symbol=t;range=ytd;compare=;indicator=sma%28200%29+bollinger+volume+stochasticslow;charttype=candlestick;crosshair=on;ohlcvalues=1;logscale=off;source=undefined; indicates that T is headed above $36 by the middle of next week. Last time T dropped below the lower Bollinger Band, T moved up nicely for four days. Notice the Stochastic is about to signal a buy.

Message.Title: Cramer says buy ATT over Verizon
Message.Msg: Just watched Cramer tonight, he says ATT is a better stock, all things considered. Better dividend, 100% ownership of wireless business and better wireline outlook.
